How to Pay for Application:

Visa Process for International Students

Summary of the Admission Requirement 2024

Application Portal:                                          Online portal

Application Fee (non-refundable):                    90 CAD for Undergraduate & 120 CAD for Graduate

Mode of Payment:                                          Visa/Master card

Academic Calendar:                                       Semester-based

Intake Seasons            :                                               Fall/Winter/Summer

Work Experience:                                       Required for Business Programs

Financial Aid:                                             Scholarships

This is to inform all interested students and the entire public that the Saskatchewan University admission for 2024 academic sessions is open online for Undergraduate Programs. The Saskatchewan Admission is open for the fall and winter or summer sessions.

Saskatchewan Admission Requirement

·         Bachelor’s degree programs (3-4 years)
·         Diploma programs (2-3 years)
·         Certificate programs (1-2 years, or can be accomplished together with a degree)
·         Non-direct entry programs requiring previous university study to enter

University of Saskatchewan Undergraduate Admissions Requirement

Application Fee: 90 CAD

  • A minimum aggregate of 70% in high school examinations.
  • English proficiency test scores.
  • School report form.
  • Letters of recommendation.
  • Statement of purpose.
  • A valid passport.
  • A CV/Resume, if required.
  • Interviews, if required.
  • Portfolios and proof of work is required in some programs like art and architecture.
  • Auditions might be required for music and dance programs.

Graduate Admission Requirements

Name of the program Academic transcripts CV/Resume Letters of recommendation Additional requirements
Master of Professional Accounting Required Required Not required Supplemental application form
Master of Arts in Anthropology Required Required 3 Writing sample required.
Master of Science in Biology Required Required Not required A statement/letter of intent.
Master of Business Administration Required Required 3 confidential required, minimum one academic A minimum score of 500 in GMAT, A statement/letter of intent.
Master in Law Required Required 3 Research statement and writing sample.

English Language Proficiency Requirements

English language proficiency must be displayed in order to get admission into the University of Saskatchewan. The English proficiency tests required and the minimum score requirements are given below.

Test UG Scores PG Scores
IELTS 6.5 7
TOEFL iBT 86 90
Cambridge C1 Advanced 176 –
CAEL 70 –
Duolingo 110 115
PTE 63

How to Apply for Admission  into Saskatchewan University

To apply for admission into Saskatchewan university,

  • Go to https://www.ouac.on.ca/
  • Click on Accéder à monPortail
  • Or Download form https://admissions.saskatchewan.ca/contactandgeneralinformation/
  • Fill same and send to the Admission Application Email
  • Saskatchewan University Application Deadline 2024

Saskatchewan University application time limit is 2024 for Undergraduate/Graduate Admissions is given as follows. All submission should keep dates.

Students, applying to Fall 2024 may apply on a continuing source using the University Of Saskatchewan Application Form. Spaces are now limited for all degrees and majors and you may be granted an option if your first choice is no longer obtainable.

Intercontinental applicants applying from high school/secondary school may pertain for the fall entry point, which begins in September the deadline is varies.

The University of Saskatchewan will be using the highest grade reported for any repeated course

Saskatchewan University Application Fees

The application Fees for admission into the 2024 academic year is 90 CAD and 120 for Graduate

How to Pay for Application:

Paying for the admission application form is done online with the help of Visa/Master card

Visa Process for International Students

The following documents are required from all internationally admitted students.

  • A valid passport
  • A Québec Acceptance Certificate (CAQ), from the Ministry of immigration for programs longer than 6 months
  • Apply for a study permit and visa
  • Quebec’s immigration law requires proof of valid health and hospitalization insurance.

Visa Application Process

Students require a Canadian student visa in order to study at University of Saskatchewan. Students need to submit official documents including financial documents to avail a Canadian student visa. They also need to sit for an interview with the embassy in their home country and bring a number of documents to the interview. The documents which are required for the visa interview are as follows.

  • Student application form, completely filled.
  • Letter of acceptance from the university.
  • A valid passport which will help the student get into Canada to study at the University of Saskatchewan.
  • Two recent passport sized photographs.
  • Financial records showing proof of enough funds either in the form of bank statements or sponsor’s statements.
  • The proof of payment of study permit.
  • English proficiency test scores like TOEFL, IELTS etc.
  • Additional documents can also be required like letters of recommendation, statement of purpose etc.

Once these documents have been displayed and the interview has been cleared, a Canadian student visa will be issued to the student.

Saskatchewan University Tuition Estimates

Canadian students International students
Tuition $6,978 $25,121
Student fees $1,050 $1,050
Books $1,500 $1,500
Total $9,528 $27,671
